head.supplied: ¶ Charles Moore Esq[r] Director of the Botanic Garden Sydney New South Wales, a zealous Botanist who has contributed largely to our knowledge of the Vegetation of Eastern Australia, being desirous of...

div.p: To the Linnean Society of London
Linnean Society of London, Certificates of Fellows, Foreign Members and Associates, 1857–64

MS was completed by G. Bentham; it is dated to the day that the nomination was read to the Society.
Charles Moore Esq[r] Director of the Botanic Garden Sydney New South Wales, a zealous Botanist who has contributed largely to our knowledge of the Vegetation of Eastern Australia, being desirous of becoming a fellow of the Linnean Society of London We the undersigned from our personal knowledge or from our acquaintance with his works and scientific labour, do recommend him as highly deserving that honor and likely to become a useful and valuable Member of the Society

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
Ferdinand Mueller (By letter to Mr Bentham)
See M to G. Bentham, 24 September 1862.

Elected Rd. K.
Richard Kippist.
